title: How to Reduce Animal Dust and Dander in Your Home

steps.headline: Vacuum common areas everyday.
steps.description: Even 2 minutes of cleaning will make a difference. Hit the areas that are your pet's favorite the most.

steps.headline: Dust furniture with Pledge and Murphy's Oil Soap (can be bought at local grocery store) weekly.
steps.description: Use a Dusting wand for hard to reach places or a quick clean up. If you have hardwood floors use a Swiffer dusting broom to clean up.

steps.headline: Regularly brush/groom your pets (outside if possible) so that they are not shedding excess in your home.
Use an air filtration system.
steps.description: If you have forced air you can buy filters for the vents and furnace. A standing system is recommended for the best air quality (remember to clean this regularly as well).

steps.headline: Air out your home when possible to get rid of dusty odors.

text: Vacuum common areas everyday. Even 2 minutes of cleaning will make a difference. Hit the areas that are your pet's favorite the most. Dust furniture with Pledge and Murphy's Oil Soap (can be bought at local grocery store) weekly. Use a Dusting wand for hard to reach places or a quick clean up. If you have hardwood floors use a Swiffer dusting broom to clean up. Regularly brush/groom your pets (outside if possible) so that they are not shedding excess in your home.  Use an air filtration system. If you have forced air you can buy filters for the vents and furnace. A standing system is recommended for the best air quality (remember to clean this regularly as well). Air out your home when possible to get rid of dusty odors.
